column4: Is it possible to remotely lock the display over an SSH session?
You can start the VNC server, then lock it the way you always would... but I wonder if there's a command.
well, the person using the PC would be able to prevent that, right? :-)
I've found something... xlockmore or xlockmore-gl
Not installed on a default Install, right?
Can you tell the prog what screen to lock?
doesn't matter though, I'm on the machine by SSH
Because if you lock the current screen with SSH, it won't lock the one somebody else is using...
Well, you just need to export DISPLAY accordingly
Does work. I just tried it.
My girl friend asked me to lock her screen after some time, so her little brother doesn't spend all day playing some game
Is there another BitTorrent tracker for the Breezy Colony 2 CD, or just the one from cdimage.ubuntulinux.org? Because there's no seeders left for that one :-/
